description: Borrowed from Old Norse dregg (“sediment”), from Proto-Germanic *dragjō (whence also Icelandic dregg, Swedish drägg), from Proto-Indo-European *dʰrā́ks (“sediment”); see also Latin fraces (“lees of oil”), Albanian ndrag (“to make dirty, foul”), dra (“sediments of dairy products or liquids”).

nouns.description: dreg (countable and uncountable, plural dregs) (chiefly in the plural)

entries.meaning: (by extension) The lowest and most worthless part of something; scum.
